intro: Hieracium pollinarium, commonly known as the meadowhawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from June to August, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are deeply lobed and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
